case_vignette: An 8-year-old girl is brought to the physician by her parents because of difficulty sleeping. One to two times per week for the past 2 months, she has woken up frightened in the middle of the night, yelling and crying. She has not seemed confused after waking up, and she is consolable and able to fall back asleep in her parents' bed. The following day, she seems more tired than usual at school. She recalls that she had a bad dream and looks for ways to delay bedtime in the evenings. She has met all her developmental milestones to date. Physical examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

No, I haven't had any illnesses or injuries.

No changes in my diet or exercise routine have been mentioned.

No changes in medication or supplements have been mentioned.

No changes in family or medical history have been mentioned.
Final Diagnosis: Night Terrors.
